text: Maybe you could hack something together with an embedded <https://www.google.co.uk/forms/about/|google form>? Or some other form as a service provider

attachments.title: Google Forms: Free Online Surveys for Personal Use
attachments.text: Create a new survey and edit it with others at the same time. Choose from a variety of pre-made themes or create your own. Free with a Google account.
attachments.fallback: Google Forms: Free Online Surveys for Personal Use

elements.text: Maybe you could hack something together with an embedded
? Or some other form as a service provider

text:
I unironically agree with <@UBN9AFS0N>. As somebody who went straight from managed hosting (cpanel) to aws, now that I've started managing a site by sshing into a box running apache, I've hit far fewer roadblocks, and the ones I've hit have been simpler to sort out.

That being said, I recently made a google sheet act as a basic cms for a site. So that could be an option too.

elements.text:
. As somebody who went straight from managed hosting (cpanel) to aws, now that I've started managing a site by sshing into a box running apache, I've hit far fewer roadblocks, and the ones I've hit have been simpler to sort out.

That being said, I recently made a google sheet act as a basic cms for a site. So that could be an option too.

text:
<@UP00ZLX6G> I’m intrigued by your suggestion! I think you can trigger AWS Lambda or Github Action via Zapier/etc based on entries to Google Forms/Airtable. And presumably you can force people to log-in with their google identity for auth purposes & record that.
I wish I thought of that two days ago :stuck_out_tongue:
Only thing I’m not sure about is how do you enforce “unique per user field” (e.g. username)

text:
I’m not convinced by “forego static+serverless” requirement & just spin up the server :slightly_smiling_face:
Looked up what it’d take to do that in Python+Flask (as I’d go there given my background vs php). And while I think is/can be/ conceptually simpler, There is a lot more code to write & infra to properly setup. & more complexity lurks around the corner..

text:
I think Netlify functions could be/are nice, but I’m still getting <https://futureofcoding.slack.com/archives/C01932BJGE8/p1610868785005700?thread_ts=1610844320.005100&cid=C01932BJGE8>
which is either bad ux (in case it’s me doing something wrong) or horrible infrastructure management (in case it’s been down for 3 days)

attachments.fallback:
[January 16th, 2021 11:33 PM] root: Netlify functions have been giving me `Function logs are currently unavailable. We are working on resolving the issue.` the whole day :disappointed:
and Amplify stuff is complex and underdocumented :disappointed:
